content:
That's a great plan! Creating separate notebooks for each property and using tags to categorize your documents will make it easy to find and access the information you need. Scanning and uploading your paper documents will also help you declutter your physical space and ensure that your important documents are safe and secure.

Remember to also consider the following:

* **Make sure to organize your tags in a way that makes sense to you**: Create a consistent tagging system that you can use across all your notebooks. This will make it easy to search and filter your documents.
* **Use clear and descriptive names for your notebooks and tags**: This will help you quickly identify the contents of each notebook and tag.
* **Set reminders and notifications**: Set reminders for important dates, such as property tax deadlines or insurance renewals, to ensure you stay on top of your responsibilities.
* **Consider sharing access with trusted individuals**: If you have a spouse, partner, or family member who needs access to your property documents, consider sharing your Evernote notebooks with them.
* **Regularly backup your data**: Make sure to regularly backup your Evernote data to ensure that your documents are safe in case something happens to your account.

By following these tips, you'll be able to create a organized and easily accessible system for managing your property documents.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask. Good luck with your organization project, and I hope you'll enjoy the peace of mind that comes with having all your property documents in one place!
